article.title: LDS Style Guide for Python Code

abstract.para: Coding conventions for the Python code of all LDS components

section.title: Introduction
section.para: A lot of LDS components are written in Python, among them the LMC agent and its Python plugin.
This document sets the coding conventions for the Python code of all LDS components.

This document is totally based on Guido Van Rossum "Style Guide for Python Code" document (see http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/): you must read it too. This document only emphases on important coding conventions.

section.title: Code layout
section.para: Indentation: use 4 spaces per indentation level, no tabs allowed. It's ok with Emacs Python mode.
Encoding: the source code must always use the UTF-8 encoding.

section.title: Whitespace in Expressions and Statements
section.screen:

section.title: Comments
section.para: They always start with a capitalized first word.
There is always a space between the # and the begin of the comment.

section.title: Docstrings
section.para: All functions and classes must have a docstring.

The docstring must be written in the Epytext Markup Language format. We use epydoc to generate the API documentation. See http://epydoc.sourceforge.net/epytext.html and http://epydoc.sourceforge.net/fields.html for more information.

section.title: Naming conventions
section.para: Module name: short, lowercase names, without underscores
Functions Names: mixedCase for instance method, lower_case_with_underscores for other.
